title: "Sweeping Changes For Leading-Edge Chip Architectures"
excerpt: "In the past, most chips contained one or two leading-edge technologies, mostly to keep pace with the expected improvements in lithography at each new process node every couple of years. Those improvements were based on industry roadmaps that called for predictable but unremarkable gains over time."
